subject: Re: [junit] Running Junit tests with several JREs within another test
msgSnippet: ... That s in agreement with what I m saying. I m trusting that System.exit(status) does what it says on the tin, and I just want to test that it gets called
messageBody:
On 14/10/05, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> Elliotte,
>
> Sometimes I would just trust that System.exit does what it says, and
> leave the little method untested. I'd do this most often in exception
> handling code, where I don't have strong customer input about the right
> thing to do, but still want to have defined behavior.
>
> On the other hand, if adding the exit was because of an explicit
> customer request or bug report, I'd probably add a shell script to my
> system ("customer") tests, outside of JUnit, to make sure that I'd
> captured the bug and the fix. I haven't done this for System.exit yet,
> but I have for other behavior only observable from the command line.
>
> David Saff
>
>
That's in agreement with what I'm saying. I'm trusting that System.exit(status)
does what it says on the tin, and I just want to test that it gets called at
the appropriate time. I realise there are occasions when an element of the
core Java classes has a bug in it - Elliotte, I think you've talked about
characterset handling in different versions of Java on one of your cafe
sites. I would consider that problem outside the scope of my control, raise
a bug and look for an alternative way of providing the necessary
functionality.

James
